title: Transcranial Pulse Stimulation for Alzheimer's Disease in an Open Prospective Pilot Study
description_brief: This is a prospective open comprehensive proof-of-principle pilot study.
description_detailed: This is a prospective open comprehensive proof-of-principle pilot study with patients of mild to moderate Alzheimer's Disease who have been treated with transcranial pulse stimulation (TPS)
drug: Transcranial Pulse Stimulation (TPS) — NEUROLITH device (Storz Medical AG)
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is Transcranial Pulse Stimulation (TPS), a non‑invasive ultrasound‑based neuromodulation therapy applied to focal brain regions with the intent to improve cognition and related symptoms in people with Alzheimer’s disease. This is described as a navigated, focused ultrasound pulse therapy (Neurolith TPS). citeturn0search7turn0search6.
